English(en): Welcome to {gametitle}!
German(de): Willkommen bei {gametitle}!

English(en): This game is about digital literacy and more specifically about how to be mindful about creating and handling passwords & access information on your social media platform(s).
Use the Cellphone Icon in the bottom right corner of your screen to get instructions and ask for help if needed.
Press {key} to beginn.
Hey, how are you?
German(de): Hey, wie gehts dir?
Notes(no): Hey, how are you? I’m sorry to bother you, but I forgot my password to my Friendbook-account. You know I trust you and I remember that you’re really good with computers and such - could you maybe help me out and access my account for me?
column6: Hey, wie gehts dir? Entschuldige bitte falls ich störe, aber ich habe irgendwie meine Logindaten für meinen Friendbook-Account vergesssen. Du weißt ich vertraue dir, und ich erinnere mich dass du immer sehr gut mit Computern und so warst - könntest du mir vielleicht helfen den Zugang zu meinem Account wiederzuerlangen?

English(en): Hey Tara! I'm doing well, how about you?
German(de): Hallo Tara! Mir gehts super und selbst?

English(en): I’m sorry to bother you, but I forgot my password to my Friendbook-account. Could you help me access my account?
German(de): Entschuldige die Störung, aber ich habe irgendwie meine Logindaten für meinen Friendbook-Account vergesssen. Könntest du mir vielleicht helfen den Zugang zu meinem Account wiederzuerlangen?

English(en): Sure, I’d love to help out!
German(de): Na klar!

English(en): Let’s check out your profile.
German(de): Lass uns mal dein Profil anschauen.

English(en): How can my profile be of any help?
German(de): Wie kann mein Profil hilfreich sein?

English(en): Well, maybe...
German(de): Ja, vielleicht...
Notes(no): Unfortunately we often use actual names and numbers that have a personal meaning instead of random ones for our passwords. I will take a close look around your profile and see if I find any clues that may help me deduce your login-information.

English(en): Unfortunately we often use actual names and numbers that have a personal meaning instead of random ones for our passwords.
German(de): Leider nutzen viele Menschen noch immer echte Namen aus ihrem sozialen Umfeld und Zahlen mit persönlicher Bedeutung in ihren Passwörtern.

English(en): Oh... That sounds like me... :(
German(de): Ohje, das klingt nach mir... :(

English(en): Lets take a look. :)
German(de): Lass uns mal schauen. :)

English(en): I will attempt to sign into your account once I think I know your email and password. I will let you know once I managed to break into your account.
German(de): Sobald ich eine Idee habe was deine email und Passwort sein könnten werde ich versuchen mich anzumelden und danach bei dir melden.

English(en): Tara Patel
German(de): Tara Patel

English(en): Nice, i hope you had fun! <3
German(de): Schön, Ich hoffe ihr hattet Spaß! <3

English(en): You guys never sit still, huh?
German(de): Ihr zwei sitzt auch nie still, oder?

English(en): Oh man, why didn't you say something? Me and Bernie woul've loved to join #dogLovers #dogs4life

English(en): Haha, I'm sorry Maria. Next time! <3
German(de): Haha, Sorry Maria. Nächstes Mal! <3

English(en): Check out my new haircut! #JustDoIt #brave
German(de): Neuer Haarschnitt! #JustDoIt #brave

English(en): Sorry, I can't tell the difference. I hope it wasn't to expensive.
German(de): Sorry, ich erkenne keinen Unterschied. Ich hoffe es war nicht teuer.

English(en): SoOoOo gorgeous! Love it! Where did you go? #jealous
German(de): SoOoOo schön! Steht dir mega gut! Wo warst du? #Neid

English(en): Dude, sweet new haircut! I hope Lucy still recognizes you, lol...
German(de): Wow, sieht richtig gut aus! Ich hoffe Lucy erkennt dich noch wieder, lol...

English(en): YESSS! We did it, Class of '02 strikes again. 1. place at the regionals! #regionals #ClassOf'02
German(de): YESSS! Wir habens geschafft, unser 02'er Jahrgang ist unschlagbar! Erster Platz bei den Regionalmeisterschaften! #RegionalMeister #2002FTW #besterJahrgang
Notes(no): TARA - [image of people, possibly {player} playing ball at a tournament or on a gras court or so]

English(en): yeah, it was a piece of cake! well done, team! '02 rules!
German(de): Jo, war mega einfach! Gut gemacht Team! Bester Jahrgang.

English(en): I said it before, and I will say it again: NOBODY can challenge 02's. Best year, best players. #ClassOf'02
German(de): Ich sagte es zuvor und ich sage es auch wieder: Niemand kann sich mit 02'ern anlegen! Bester Jahrgang, beste Spieler*innen! Und bestaussehend noch dazu ^^... #2002FTW

English(en): CONGRATULATIONS! I'm really proud of you guys! GO TEAM!
German(de): Spitze! Ich bin echt stolz auf euch! Hip Hip Hurrah!

English(en): PS: Guys, I took a bunch of pictures at the game. Would you like me to email them to you?
German(de): PS: Leute, I habe einiges an Fotos gemacht beim Spiel. Wollt ihr die zugeschickt haben?

English(en): Oh sweet! Yes please, thats amazing, could you send them to me too? My email is: Tara.P@gmailer.com. Thank you Shaurya, you're the best! <3
German(de): Oh ja bitte! Magst du mir dir auch noch zuschicken? Meine email-Adresse ist: Tara.P@gmailer.com. Vielen lieben Dank Shaurya, bist die Beste! <3

English(en): Amazing you guys! congrats!!!
German(de): Gut gemacht! Herzlichen Glückwunsch zum Titel!!!

English(en): You know it!!!! GO '02!!!!
German(de): Ihr wisst Bescheid!!!! 2002'er Elite!!!

English(en): Not bad you guys, not bad at all!
German(de): Gar nicht mal so schlecht...

English(en): Wow, high praise from grumpy Paul! Thank you ;)
German(de): Haha, hohes Lob von Miesepeter-Paul! :D Danke dir!

English(en): I just cant get over how cute Lucy is. Even when she's sleeping.
German(de): ich komm einfach nicht klar wie niedlich Lucy ist. Sogar wenn sie schläft.

English(en): #love
German(de): #Love

English(en): Not quite as cute as my Bernie, but very close! ;) #dogLovers
German(de): Nicht ganz so niedlich wie mein Bernie, aber ziemlich dicht dran! ;) #HundDesJahres

English(en): It's weird to say, but she's literally the best thing that's ever happened to me... <3 #sorrynotsorry
German(de): Ich weiß es klingt komisch, aber sie ist im wahrsten Sinne des Wortes das Beste, was mir je passiert ist... <3 #InLove

English(en): How is it going? Do you have any idea what my login information may be?
German(de): Wie kommst du voran? Hast du eine Idee was meine Login-Informationen sind?

English(en): Your dog is super cute!
German(de): Dein Hund ist echt niedlich!

English(en): I noticed you post lots of pictures and mention her a lot. I may have an idea what your login-information may be ;)
German(de): Du postest echt viel über sie... Ich habe da eine idee was dein Passwort sein könnte ;)

English(en): And I think I saw your email in one of the comments.
German(de): Und ich glaube ich sah deine Email in einem der Kommentare.

English(en): Did it work?
German(de): Hat es funktioniert

English(en): Hmmm…
German(de): Hmmm...
Notes(no): Hmmm… I found your email-address on your dashboard and think your password may be your dog's name, but I remember that Friendbook requires you to use numbers in their passwords too… I think I have an idea which numbers you may have used...

English(en): I think I know your email-address and your password may be your dog's name, but I remember that Friendbook requires you to use numbers in their passwords too…
German(de): Ich habe deine Email-Adresse in den Kommentaren gesehen und dein Passwort ist vermutlich der Name deines Hundes... Aber wenn ich mich recht erinnere müssen Friendbook-Passwörter neben Buchstaben auch nach Zahlen enthalten...

English(en): You know what, with all the clues you gave me I think I remember: my account was linked to Tara.P@gmailer.com and my password must have been Lucy02
German(de): Weißt du was, mit all den Hinweisen von dir glaube ich sind mir meine Login-Informationen wieder eingefallen. Meine Email sollte Tara.P@gmailer.com sein und mein Passwort muss entweder Lucy02 oder Lucy2002 sein...

English(en): Happy I could help!
German(de): Gar kein Thema :)

English(en): WOW, you got access to my account simply by browsing the information I posted on my public profile... I will make a more secure password and look into my privacy settings!
German(de): Oha, du hast den Zugang zu meinem Friendbook-Account nur durch das lesen meine einsehbaren Pinnwand und Infos herausgefunden? Ich glaube ich werde direkt mal ein neues, sichereres Passwort anlegen und meine Privatssphäre-Einstellungen überarbeiten!
Notes(no): WOW! You you did it, thanks! You got access to my account simply by browsing the information I posted on my public profile - That is very scary! I should make a more secure password right away and maybe look into my privacy settings!

English(en): I’m happy I could help!
German(de): Ich bin froh dass ich helfen konnte.

English(en): And I agree, you should probably make some changes before someone else gets access to your account as well!
German(de): Und ja, auf jeden Fall. Das solltest du auf jeden Fall tun.

English(en): Bye!
German(de): Machs gut! :)

German(de): Tara.P@gmailer.com

English(en): Babette Advik
Notes(no): Mutter der Spieler, im chat nur "Mom" / "Mama" genannt. NOT C2!!! the dad is the one chatting and looking for info on the MOMs profile!

English(en): Berlin, Germany
Babette.Advik@mymail.com
Spending time with my family!
Vacations
Painting
Hey! I’m trying to log into our bank account, mom gave me the new account name and password, but now I'm stuck!
Ok, how can I help?
Well, I have to answer these “security-questions” she set up to log in and I can’t reach her by phone. I figured you may know the answers or could help me figure them out? These are the questions:

Who was her first teacher?
What was the name of her first pet?
What was her first car?
Sorry, dad. I don't know any of those. But maybe I can find the answers on her Friendbook profile.
How could her social media profile be of any help?
Many people overshare on social media. We often post things on the internet without considering possible, negative ramifications. Sometimes seemingly “harmless” posts can reveal more than we intend.
But you won’t “hack” into her account or do something sketchy, right?
German(de): Aber du wirst jetzt nicht ihren Account "hacken" oder irgendetwas anstellen, nicht wahr?

English(en): No, of course not!
German(de): Nein, natürlich nicht!

English(en): Ok. Well, let me know if you find anything! Thanks for helping.
Feeling down today... Does anyone have an idea on what to do?
Sorry, Babs, this bad weather has me down too. There really isn't much to do if it rains all day...
No worries friend. I will swing by later after work and we will watch a movie, what do you say?
actually that sounds really nice... Thank you! :)
Are you coming by car?
Sure am!
Ok, then I'll move the car to make room in the driveway! See you in a bit :)
Can't wait <3
Oh, oh, oh! Can I join when I get off work?
No
No
How about me?
Of course, Mustafa! The more the merrier :) <3
A good day to be alive!
Our family vacation last year! We got to see the mountains and even made it to the coast. I can't believe we didn't have a single mechanical isse. It was such a great time, I can't wait to go back!
Notes(no): BABETTE - [image of C2, with MOM and child (Player) infront of an old VW Beetle]

English(en): Haha, that's awesome!!! Great to see your old Beetle still going strong!
That's nice! I believe I've been to that exact spot before...
Wow, that's quite the trip you guys! Is that still the Beetle you got way back when we graduated together?
Haha, yeah, I guess it is. Sometimes I forget for how long I've had this lovely little car! Still First and Only!
So true! I remember us taking it for a joyride the weekend of graduation and getting a flat tire less than 20 minutes in. Glad to hear it's gotten more sturdy! Go Beetle!
You are so right, honey! We should do this again soon! This time without kids though!
Aweee!!! You guys are so cute!
I am so excited! I've worked so hard for this and am very proud to say: I finally got the promotion I've been fighting for for so long!
Notes(no): BABETTE - [image of MOM outside of the entrance to an office building, wearing a sharp work blouse, looking ready to go]

English(en): I'm happy to hear that things are coming together for you, Babette!
Congrats, honey!!! I'm so proud of you!!! You deserve this! <3
:D You should hit up Mrs. Applecherry and tell her of your success. Prove that old lady wrong! Once and for all!
Oh wow, trueeee... That's so long ago... Can't believe you remember
Wait. What am I missing? Who are you talking about?
You'r not missing anything, Sarah. Mrs. Applecherry was the first teacher and me had. I don't think any of her pupils would ever forget that lingering stare.

... She was a handfull... She'd NEVER miss an opportunity to let us know, that with our "work-ethics" none of us were to amount to anything in "that world out there". Babette proved her wrong, I am so proud! #BossLady #ChiefMarketingOfficer #NewOpportunities
I got you. That's great! Well done on proving her wrong!
Yes, I'm super happy. But let's not lay into Mrs. Applecherry, I saw her at the grocery store last week, and she really is the nicest old lady! She always meant well and only tried to motivate us.
Haha, thinking about it: where is my promotion though?
Soon honey, soon! Maybe ;)... Just teasing <3
Anyone still playing Candy Crunch Saga?
No, but I'd be down for some LOL!
Oh fun! I will add you to my "favorites". What is your email? lol^^
... I feel like I'm at fault here... It was great chatting Ms. Advik
Hey, this is my friend's new, used car. Now I know two of you with the Citroën 2CV (yes, I had to google that!). Such a cool car!
Such a small world!
Well, thats a really cool car, but it's not the same as mine, I've always had a beetle. But agreed, they're both cool cars.
Aaah, I see. I just looked it up, they really look very similar. Unfortunately my friend's car is now in the shop for repairs. She drove into a ditch when avoiding a deer last week.
Oh nooo! That is very dangerous! Happened to my parents when I was still very young
What, really? That's scary! Were they going too fast or something? (I think my friend was, but don't tell her that)

Yes, I guess so. And worse yet: I think it was my fault! Most people don't know this, but I had a pet rabbit back then, named Mena, only pet I ever had, and for a reason... One day I fed it a chocolat carrot and the poor little thing ate it whole, including the wrapper. I got so scared and told my parents that I had poised Mena and was so upset they took Mena and me to the veterenarian... Of course the animal turnt out to be fine, but I stressed my poor parents so much that they nearly ran into a deer and swerved of the street. It was not a good day, but luckely nothing happend but a few scratches..
I never knew you nearly got your family killed over a pet rabbit with a craving for chocolate, lol.
I know someone who would literally drive right through a deer... or a human probably... to save her dog! :D :D :D
I feel attacked! Tara is much worse than I am.
Leave me out of this! ...but true #sorrynotsorry
That looks just like my first car!!! even the same color! You know, in Germany they are called "Ente" (engl. "duck"). Those were the days...
Applecherry
Notes(no): with all these entries we should accept lower cases and upper cases

English(en): Mrs. Applecherry
Mrs Applecherry
Mena
Beetle
VW Beetle
Volkswagen Beetle
VW Käfer
Volkswagen Käfer
Hey Dad, I think the name of my mom's favorite teacher was: [inputField].
That doesn't seem right...
Great! Thank you!
So, I think her first pet's name was: [inputField].
That doesn't ring a bell...
Awesome! Thank you!
Pretty sure mom's first car was a: [inputField].
I don't think that's it...
Well Done! Thank you!

I think there was a picture of us on vacation with her car in the background - I believe that was her first car! Also there is a picture of an old car , and mom made a comment about her pet rabbit. Lastly there was something about Moms new job. Mom and her friend talk about their early school years. Could you check those out for me, as I dont have my computer here?
After thinking about it a bit more, I think her car was a Beetle, her pet's name was Mena and her teacher's first name was Mrs. Applecherry. Thank you for checking and helping me remember!

Wow, great job, those three worked! It’s scary what you can find out about someone just from their social network profile. I will look at my profiles privacy and security settings right now and ask mom to do the same! Thanks again!

Glad I could help! Good idea, most of the shared information is pretty harmless on it's own, but you never know what someone else may use it for. We should always be very mindful about our privacy settings!
paul12@mymail.com

English(en):
Even though your password was long it was easy to guess, use
numbers, symbols and capital letters to make your password 
stronger.
German(de): Benutze am Besten eine Kombination von kleinen und großen Buchstaben, Nummern und Symbolen um deine Passwörter sicherer zu gestalten.

English(en):
Yes, you are right. I should add those in my new password to 
make it stronger. Thanks for the help! bye!
German(de): Ja, du hast Recht. Ich werde direkt ein neues Passwort kreieren und deinen Rat beachten. Vielen Dank für alles!

Oh! My password was so simple, I should definitely keep a 
better password from now on. Thank you for helping me!
German(de): Oha, ja, meine Passwörter sind definitiv zu schwach. Vielen Dank für deine Hilfe

English(en): Glad I could help!

English(en): Even though your password had a symbol, a capital letter and a number that is not enough, next time make sure your password consists of more than 12 characters!
German(de): Auch wenn dein passwort sowohl Groß- als auch kleingeschriebene Buchstaben, ein Symbol und eine Zahl enthielt, reicht das noch nicht um ein wirklich sicheres Passwort zu erstellen. Idealerweise besteht ein Passwort auch aus Symbolen, diversen Zahlen und mehreren Wörtern oder unzusammenhängenden Buchstabenkombinationen.

English(en):
Thanks for the tip!
Quick question- I used the same password for my MyGram 
account, should I change it too?
German(de): Danke für den Rat! Eine kurze Frage: Da ich ja dasselbe Passwort für meinen Friendbook als auch MyGram-Account verwende, sollte ich beide ändern?

English(en):
Yes, you should definitely change your MyGram password too. 
And make sure not to keep the same password for different 
apps.Always use different and long passwords for every app 
and website.
German(de): Ja, auf jeden Fall! Jeder der sich dein Profil kurz anschaut kann vermutlcih dieses Passwort knacken. Es ist generell wichtig verschiedene Passwörter für jede Platform und Anmeldung zu erstellen - Ansonsten besteht ein sehr hohes Sicherheitsrisiko.

English(en): I will remember that, thanks for all your tips  :-)
German(de): Du hast völlig Recht! Echt, super vielen Dank für deine Hilfe und Ratschläge!

English(en):
Hey, It's me again, I’m having trouble remembering all my p
asswords. Is there any way to make it automatically?
Yes, you can use a password Manager
What is a Password Manager?

A password manager is a program that allows you to store, 
generate and manage their passwords

Basically password manager will create complex
passwords automatically
That sounds useful!
Can you help me with it?
Sure!
I’ll share my screen now
I’ll fill my name and email quickly
What is this master password?
Is it any different from a regular password?
A master password is same as a regular password

But in password manager it is used to save all your passwords 
and data which only you can access it

Your master password should be unique and memorable so 
that only you can access it
Okay, what should I use in my master password?
My Name

Never use your personal name or someone you 
know in your password!
My Email
Never use your email in your password!
Random Words

Use very unique and random words like Honey, raid, conductor, 
trafficlights etc..

But do not use very common words like password, dragon, 
qwerty and many other as these are the mostly used password.
Use both Uppercase and Lowercase letters in the password

Okay, I used random words with both Uppercase and 
Lowercase letters
Now, what else should I use?
You can use numbers
How should I use numbers?

Never use continuous numbers like 123456,11111, etc
in your password!
Random Numbers
Use random numbers in your password

You can use them at the start, middle or at the
 end of your password
I have added numbers to my password
My Date of Birth

Never use your birthday, phone number or other actual 
combination of numbers etc in your password!

Are there any other tricks I can use to improve my 
password strength?

Use different symbols like @,$,+,(,:, etc
and mix them into your password
Avoid putting all of them in the same place
Okay, I have added symbols to my password
I have done everything you said
Now how long should my password be?
Maximum of 8 characters
Your password is weak!
Greater than 12 characters

Passwords should be longer than 12 because they are 
strong and cannot be easily guessed or cracked
Okay! It’s finally done

But the password I have created is very complex and 
I don’t think I can remember this
This is my password - “8floWourr$#watEr”
Is there any easier way to do this?

Your password is strong, complex and unique but it can 
be hard to remember.
And do not share your password with anyone not even with me.

You can use Passphrase, it is similar to passwords but they 
are very long and can have 20-30 characters.
You can make a story and use it as a password.

Example - You kicked a ball that hit a doorbell and then you 
went to hide
Then the passphrase could be - Kick8all-hit-doorbell-hide

Now this is something unique to you and only you know 
this happened.

This will be easier to remember and it is much longer and 
stronger than your regular password
Passphrases should have at least 4 random words.

You can add symbols,numbers in your passphrase to make it
even more stronger
Wow! This is very useful and now I can remember my password.
I learned a lot from you, Thank you very much for your help!
Doesn’t matter
Password still weak!
Continue
German(de): Weiter

English(en):
In 2021 a study by NCSC UK concluded that:

15% of internet-users use their pets name in their passwords
14% use their family members names
13% use a significant date
6% use their favorite sports team
German(de):
In 2021 hat eine Studie der NCSC UK herausgefunden, dass:

15% der befragten Internet-Nutzer den Namen ihres Haustieres in Passwörtern verwenden
14% nutzen den/die Namen von Familienmitgliedern
13% nutzen ein besonderes Datum für Zahlen
6% nutzen ihren bevorzugten Sportverein oder Team

English(en): Paws-word change recommended on National Pet Day (April 9th, 2021), National Cyber Security Center U.K., accessed 11 April 2021,
German(de): Paws-word change recommended on National Pet Day (2021, 9. April). National Cyber Security Center U.K.; Stand: 11.4.2021 auf

English(en): https://www.ncsc.gov.uk/news/national-pet-day-password-advice
German(de): https://www.ncsc.gov.uk/news/national-pet-day-password-advice

English(en):
A report compiled for Online-Education.net © concluded that:

28% of social-media-users share their feeds / wall with more than just their friends
63% do not customize their privacy settings for apps  
20% do not use privacy controls at all

"fun"-fact:

78% of ex-burglars interviewed in the UK in 2012 believe that thieves use social media to identify targets
German(de):
Ein für Online-Education.net © zusammengetragener Bericht kam zu folgenden Erkenntnissen:

28% der befragten Nutzer von sozialen Netzwerken teilen den Zugang zu ihrem "Feed" / "Wall" mit mehr Personen als nur ihren Freunden
63% stellen die Privatsphäre-Optionen ihrer Apps nicht um
20% benutzen generell keine Privatsphäre-Einstellungen

"fun"-fact:

78% von in 2012 in Groß Britanien befragten, ehemaligen Einbrechern ging davon aus, dass (aktive) Diebe Soziale Medien nutzen um Ziele zu identifizieren

English(en): Oversharing and Social Media (Jan. 7th, 2020), Illinois workNet Center, accessed 11 April 2021,
German(de): Oversharing and Social Media (2020, 7. Januar). Illinois workNet Center; Stand: 11.4.2021 auf
